title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. "Taylor Made"

C. "Modest Proposals"

D. "Midnights"

---

2. Rishi Sunak became Britain's new prime minister. Where did he get his MBA?

A. Harvard

B. Stanford

C. Wharton

D. Oberlin

---

3. Intel raised $861 million selling stock in its Mobileye Global unit -- which is in what business?

A. Ophthalmoplegia drugs

B. High-precision mapping

C. Satellite-based surveillance

D. Driverless car technology

---

4. Per a new survey, how much do Americans think their households will need to retire comfortably?

A. $625,000

B. $1.25 million

C. $2.5 million

D. $5 million

---

5. Under a new SEC rule, what will happen to executives when a significant accounting error emerges?

A. A mandatory 12-week accounting class

B. Loss of 90 days' salary

C. Clawback of incentive pay

D. Personal liability for shareholder losses

---

6. Israel will extract natural gas from the sea after signing an agreement with which traditionally hostile neighbor?

A. Syria

B. Egypt

C. Lebanon

D. Saudi Arabia

---

7. Elon Musk bought Twitter, fired top executives, and tweeted -- what?

A. "The eagle has landed."

B. "The bird is freed."

C. "Chief Twit has claws."

D. "Let's make a long story short."

---

8. A key recession predictor flashed red. Which one?

A. More than half of Americans know someone jobless.

B. The dollar bought 150 Japanese yen.

C. In Treasuries, three-month yields topped 10-year yields.

D. The Dow industrials fell for 12 straight weeks.

---

9. Apple said iPhones will comply with an EU law mandating a certain type of charger. Which?

A. USB-C

B. HDMI

C. SD

D. Hand crank

---

ANSWERS

1. D

2. B

3. D

4. B

5. C

6. C

7. B

8. C

9. A
